intro: Lesliegraecum salazianum, commonly known as the Salazianum dandelion, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads, which are dispersed by the wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
